Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Flowery \Flow"er*y\, a. 1. Full of flowers; abounding with blossoms. [1913 Webster]
2. Highly embellished with figurative language; florid; as, a flowery style. --Milton. [1913 Webster]
{The flowery kingdom}, China. [1913 Webster]
flowery adj : marked by elaborate rhetoric and elaborated with decorative details; "a flowery speech"; "ornate rhetoric taught out of the rule of Plato"-John Milton [syn: {ornate}]
